climbs.name: Viral
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel, Jeff Scheuerell, Marty Lewis; 3/2020

content.description: Climb a patina slab, then finish on the steeper headwall above.
content.location: Around the corner from Malt Linker.  Just before the obvious chimney that separates the wall into two sections.  Starts from a stabilizing platform.

climbs.name: Inner Reaches
climbs.fa: Jeff Scheuerell,  Darrell Hensel, Marty Lewis

content.description: A fun well protected route with some, you guessed it, big reaches between  great pockets and positive edges
content.location: This is the last route on the wall at the top of the hill on the east side of the gorge just  before entering the Narrows from the south.

climbs.name: Inner Mingler
climbs.fa: Jeff Scheuerell,  Darrell Hensel, Marty Lewis

content.description: A short thin start to fun jug hauling. Get  a good  rest before a pumpy finish to reach the  bucket at the first set of Mussys
content.location: The middle route on the wall that is right of the chimney( between Deep State and Inner Reaches). It intermingles with  Deep State but ends before things get too hard

climbs.name: Deep State
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel, Jeff Scheuerell, Marty Lewis; 6/2020

content.description:
Start with a thin patina crux on good rock past 4 bolts.   It's natural to use the arete when doing the crux, for a slightly harder option stay on the patina to the right.

At this point the wall above steepens to gently overhanging jug climbing.   As the jugs diminish at the first set of mussies finish by moving left onto the arete.

While the rock is initially high quality the top of the wall does deteriorate somewhat.  The arete finish is well protected in a nice location but the lower set of mussies is also an end of route option.
content.protection: 11 bolts to lower mussy anchor, 15 bolts to higher mussy anchor.
content.location:
At the centroid of the ORG.  The Inner Sanctum wall is as deep in the Gorge as it gets, equally distant to approach from any direction. Since the route is at the center of the most remote wall it is by default at the deepest point within the Gorge.

Immediately right of the wide crack that splits the center of the main wall.

climbs.name: Covid (Seriously Though)
climbs.fa: Marty Lewis, Darrell Hensel, Jeff Scheuerell, 7/2020

content.description: A powerful boulder problem leads to techy face, then up a short slab to overhanging huecos. This route climbs really well, but it is a little crumbly in spots. Hopefully traffic will clean to up.
content.location: Starts at the toe of the buttress.
